item.text: They told David, “The Philistines are fighting in Keilah and are looting the threshing floors.”
So David asked the Lord, “Should I go and strike down these Philistines?” The Lord said to David, “Go, strike down the Philistines and deliver Keilah.”
But David’s men said to him, “We are afraid while we are still here in Judah. What will it be like if we go to Keilah against the armies of the Philistines?”
So David asked the Lord once again. But again the Lord replied, “Arise, go down to Keilah, for I will give the Philistines into your hand.”
So David and his men went to Keilah and fought the Philistines. He took away their cattle and thoroughly defeated them. David delivered the inhabitants of Keilah.
Now when Abiathar son of Ahimelech had fled to David at Keilah, he had brought with him an ephod.

When <st data-num="07586" class="">Saul</st> was <st data-num="05046" class="">told</st> <st data-num="03588" class="">that</st> <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> had <st data-num="0935" class="">come</st> to <st data-num="07084" class="">Keilah</st>, <st data-num="07586" class="">Saul</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “<st data-num="0430" class="">God</st> has <st data-num="05234" class="">delivered</st><n id="1" /> him into my <st data-num="03027" class="">hand</st>, <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> he has <st data-num="05462" class="">boxed</st> himself <st data-num="05462" class="">into a corner</st> by <st data-num="0935" class="">entering</st> a <st data-num="05892" class="">city</st> with two <st data-num="01280" class="">barred</st> <st data-num="01817" class="">gates</st>.”<n id="2" />
So Saul mustered all his army to go down to Keilah and besiege David and his men.
When David realized that Saul was planning to harm him, he told Abiathar the priest, “Bring the ephod.”
Then David said, “O Lord God of Israel, your servant has clearly heard that Saul is planning to come to Keilah to destroy the city because of me.

Will the leaders of Keilah deliver me into his hand? Will Saul come down as your servant has heard? O Lord God of Israel, please inform your servant.”

Then the Lord said, “He will come down.”
David asked, “Will the leaders of Keilah deliver me and my men into Saul’s hand?” The Lord said, “They will deliver you over.”
So David and his men, who numbered about 600, set out and left Keilah; they moved around from one place to another. When told that David had escaped from Keilah, Saul called a halt to his expedition.

<st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> <st data-num="03427" class="">stayed</st> in the <st data-num="04679" class="">strongholds</st> that were in the <st data-num="04057" class="">desert</st> <st data-num="03427" class="">and</st> in the <st data-num="02022" class="">hill country</st> of the <st data-num="04057" class="">wilderness</st> of <st data-num="02128" class="">Ziph</st>. <st data-num="07586" class="">Saul</st> <st data-num="01245" class="">looked for</st> him <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="03117" class="">time</st>,<n id="1" /> but <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st> did <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="05414" class="">deliver</st> David<n id="2" /> into his <st data-num="03027" class="">hands</st>.
David realized that Saul had come out to seek his life; at that time David was in Horesh in the wilderness of Ziph.
Then Jonathan son of Saul left and went to David at Horesh. He encouraged him through God.

He <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> him, “<st data-num="0408" class="">Don’t</st> <st data-num="03372" class="">be afraid</st>! <st data-num="03588" class="">For</st> the <st data-num="03027" class="">hand</st> of my <st data-num="01" class="">father</st> <st data-num="07586" class="">Saul</st> <st data-num="03808" class="">cannot</st> <st data-num="04672" class="">find</st> you. <st data-num="0859" class="">You</st> will <st data-num="04427" class="">rule</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">over</st> <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>, and <st data-num="0595" class="">I</st> will <st data-num="01961" class="">be</st> your <st data-num="04932" class="">second-in-command</st>. <st data-num="01571" class="">Even</st> my <st data-num="01" class="">father</st> <st data-num="07586" class="">Saul</st> <st data-num="03045" class="">realizes</st> <st data-num="03651" class="">this</st>.”
When the two of them had made a covenant before the Lord, David stayed at Horesh, but Jonathan went to his house.
Then the Ziphites went up to Saul at Gibeah and said, “Isn’t David hiding among us in the strongholds at Horesh on the hill of Hakilah, south of Jeshimon?
Now at your own discretion, O king, come down. Delivering him into the king’s hand will be our responsibility.”
Saul replied, “May you be blessed by the Lord, for you have had compassion on me.

<st data-num="01980 04994">Go</st> and <st data-num="03559" class="">make</st> <st data-num="05750" class="">further</st> <st data-num="03559" class="">arrangements</st>. <st data-num="03045" class="">Determine</st> <st data-num="07200" class="">precisely</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="04725 0834">where</st> <st data-num="07272" class="">he</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">is</st><n id="2" /> and <st data-num="04310" class="">who</st> has <st data-num="07200" class="">seen</st> him <st data-num="08033" class="">there</st>, <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> I <st data-num="0559 0413">am told</st> that <st data-num="01931" class="">he</st> <st data-num="06191" class="">is</st> <st data-num="06191" class="">extremely</st> <st data-num="06191" class="">cunning</st>.
Locate precisely all the places where he hides and return to me with dependable information. Then I will go with you. If he is in the land, I will find him among all the thousands of Judah.”
So they left and went to Ziph ahead of Saul. Now David and his men were in the wilderness of Maon, in the rift valley to the south of Jeshimon.

<st data-num="07586" class="">Saul</st> and his <st data-num="0376" class="">men</st> <st data-num="01980" class="">went</st> to <st data-num="01245" class="">look for</st> him.<n id="1" /> But <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> was <st data-num="05046" class="">informed</st> and <st data-num="03381" class="">went down</st> to the <st data-num="05553" class="">rock</st> and <st data-num="03427" class="">stayed</st> in the <st data-num="04057" class="">wilderness</st> of <st data-num="04584" class="">Maon</st>. When <st data-num="07586" class="">Saul</st> <st data-num="08085" class="">heard</st> about it, he <st data-num="07291 0310">pursued</st> <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> in the <st data-num="04057" class="">wilderness</st> of <st data-num="04584" class="">Maon</st>.

<st data-num="07586" class="">Saul</st> <st data-num="01980" class="">went</st> on <st data-num="02088" class="">one</st> <st data-num="06654" class="">side</st> of the <st data-num="02022" class="">mountain</st>, while <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> and his <st data-num="0376" class="">men</st> went on the <st data-num="02088" class="">other</st> <st data-num="06654" class="">side</st> of the <st data-num="02022" class="">mountain</st>. <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">was</st> <st data-num="02648" class="">hurrying</st> to <st data-num="01980" class="">get away</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">from</st> <st data-num="07586" class="">Saul</st>, but <st data-num="07586" class="">Saul</st> and his <st data-num="0376" class="">men</st> were <st data-num="05849 0413">surrounding</st> <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> and his <st data-num="0376" class="">men</st> to <st data-num="08610" class="">capture</st> them.
But a messenger came to Saul saying, “Come quickly, for the Philistines have raided the land!”
So Saul stopped pursuing David and went to confront the Philistines. Therefore that place is called Sela Hammahlekoth.
(24:1) Then David went up from there and stayed in the strongholds of En Gedi.
